00002 
00003 #ifndef DatumLibrary_H
00004 #define DatumLibrary_H
00005 
00006 /***************************************************************************/
00007 /* RSC IDENTIFIER: Datum Library
00008  *
00009  * ABSTRACT
00010  *
00011  *    This component provides datum shifts for a large collection of local
00012  *    datums, WGS72, and WGS84.  A particular datum can be accessed by using its
00013  *    standard 5-letter code to find its index in the datum table.  The index
00014  *    can then be used to retrieve the name, type, ellipsoid code, and datum
00015  *    shift parameters, and to perform shifts to or from that datum.
00016  *
00017  *    By sequentially retrieving all of the datum codes and/or names, a menu
00018  *    of the available datums can be constructed.  The index values resulting
00019  *    from selections from this menu can then be used to access the parameters
00020  *    of the selected datum, or to perform datum shifts involving that datum.
00021  *
00022  *    This component supports both 3-parameter local datums, for which only X,
00023  *    Y, and Z translations relative to WGS 84 have been defined, and
00024  *    7-parameter local datums, for which X, Y, and Z rotations, and a scale
00025  *    factor, are also defined.  It also includes entries for WGS 84 (with an
00026  *    index of 0), and WGS 72 (with an index of 1), but no shift parameter
00027  *    values are defined for these.
00028  *
00029  *    This component provides datum shift functions for both geocentric and
00030  *    geodetic coordinates.  WGS84 is used as an intermediate state when
00031  *    shifting from one local datum to another.  When geodetic coordinates are
00032  *    given Molodensky's method is used, except near the poles where the 3-step
00033  *    step method is used instead.  Specific algorithms are used for shifting
00034  *    between WGS72 and WGS84.
00035  *
00036  *    This component depends on two data files, named 3_param.dat and
00037  *    7_param.dat, which contain the datum parameter values.  Copies of these
00038  *    files must be located in the directory specified by the value of the
00039  *    environment variable "MSPCCS_DATA", if defined, or else in the current
00040  *    directory whenever a program containing this component is executed.
00041  *
00042  *    Additional datums can be added to these files, either manually or using
00043  *    the Create_Datum function.  However, if a large number of datums are
00044  *    added, the datum table array sizes in this component will have to be
00045  *    increased.
00046  *
00047  *    This component depends on two other components: the Ellipsoid component
00048  *    for access to ellipsoid parameters; and the Geocentric component for
00049  *    conversions between geodetic and geocentric coordinates.
00050  *
00051  * ERROR HANDLING
00052  *
00053  *    This component checks for input file errors and input parameter errors.
00054  *    If an invalid value is found, the error code is combined with the current
00055  *    error code using the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error
00056  *    codes to be returned. The possible error codes are:
00057  *
00058  *  DATUM_NO_ERROR                  : No errors occurred in function
00059  *  DATUM_NOT_INITIALIZED_ERROR     : Datum module has not been initialized
00060  *  DATUM_7PARAM_FILE_OPEN_ERROR    : 7 parameter file opening error
00061  *  DATUM_7PARAM_FILE_PARSING_ERROR : 7 parameter file structure error
00062  *  DATUM_7PARAM_OVERFLOW_ERROR     : 7 parameter table overflow
00063  *  DATUM_3PARAM_FILE_OPEN_ERROR    : 3 parameter file opening error
00064  *  DATUM_3PARAM_FILE_PARSING_ERROR : 3 parameter file structure error
00065  *  DATUM_3PARAM_OVERFLOW_ERROR     : 3 parameter table overflow
00066  *  DATUM_INVALID_INDEX_ERROR       : Index out of valid range (less than one
00067  *                                      or more than Number_of_Datums)
00068  *  DATUM_INVALID_SRC_INDEX_ERROR   : Source datum index invalid
00069  *  DATUM_INVALID_DEST_INDEX_ERROR  : Destination datum index invalid
00070  *  DATUM_INVALID_CODE_ERROR        : Datum code not found in table
00071  *  DATUM_LAT_ERROR                 : Latitude out of valid range (-90 to 90)
00072  *  DATUM_LON_ERROR                 : Longitude out of valid range (-180 to
00073  *                                    360)
00074  *  DATUM_SIGMA_ERROR               : Standard error values must be positive
00075  *                                    (or -1 if unknown)
00076  *  DATUM_DOMAIN_ERROR              : Domain of validity not well defined
00077  *  DATUM_ELLIPSE_ERROR             : Error in ellipsoid module
00078  *  DATUM_NOT_USERDEF_ERROR         : Datum code is not user defined - cannot
00079  *                                    be deleted
00080  *
00081  *
00082  * REUSE NOTES
00083  *
00084  *    Datum is intended for reuse by any application that needs access to
00085  *    datum shift parameters relative to WGS 84.
00086  *
00087  *
00088  * REFERENCES
00089  *
00090  *    Further information on Datum can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00091  *
00092  *    Datum originated from :  U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center (USATEC)
00093  *                             Geospatial Information Division (GID)
00094  *                             7701 Telegraph Road
00095  *                             Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00096  *
00097  * LICENSES
00098  *
00099  *    None apply to this component.
00100  *
00101  * RESTRICTIONS
00102  *
00103  *    Datum has no restrictions.
00104  *
00105  * ENVIRONMENT
00106  *
00107  *    Datum was tested and certified in the following environments:
00108  *
00109  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC 2.8.1
00110  *    2. MS Windows 95 with MS Visual C++ 6
00111  *
00112  * MODIFICATIONS
00113  *
00114  *    Date              Description
00115  *    ----              -----------
00116  *    11/20/08          Original Code
00117  */
00118

00131     class MSP_DTCC_API DatumLibrary
00132     {
00133     public:
00134 
00135       /*
00136        * The constructor creates an empty list to store the datum information
00137        *  contained in two external files, 3_param.dat and 7_param.dat.  
00138        */
00139 
00140             DatumLibrary( DatumLibraryImplementation* __datumLibraryImplementation );
00141 
00142 
00143       DatumLibrary( const DatumLibrary &d );
00144 
00145 
00146       DatumLibrary& operator=( const DatumLibrary &d );
00147

00149             ~DatumLibrary( void );
00150 
00151 
00152       /* The function defineDatum creates a new local (3 or 7-parameter) datum with the
00153        * specified code, name, shift values, and standard error values or rotation and scale factor values.  
00154        * If the datum table has not been initialized, the specified code is already in use,
00155        * or a new version of the 3-param.dat or 7-param.dat file cannot be created, an 
00156        * exception is thrown.  Note that the indexes
00157        * of all datums in the datum table may be changed by this function.
00158        *
00159        *   datumType     : Specifies 3 parameter or 7 parameter datum    (input)
00160        *   datumCode     : 5-letter new datum code.                      (input)
00161        *   datumName     : Name of the new datum                         (input)
00162        *   ellipsoidCode : 2-letter code for the associated ellipsoid    (input)
00163        *   deltaX        : X translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00164        *   deltaY        : Y translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00165        *   deltaZ        : Z translation to WGS84 in meters              (input)
00166        *   sigmaX        : Standard error in X in meters                 (input)
00167        *   sigmaY        : Standard error in Y in meters                 (input)
00168        *   sigmaZ        : Standard error in Z in meters                 (input)
00169        *   westLongitude : Western edge of validity rectangle in radians (input)
00170        *   eastLongitude : Eastern edge of validity rectangle in radians (input)
00171        *   southLatitude : Southern edge of validity rectangle in radians(input)
00172        *   northLatitude : Northern edge of validity rectangle in radians(input)
00173        *   rotationX     : X rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00174        *   rotationY     : Y rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00175        *   rotationZ     : Z rotation to WGS84 in arc seconds            (input)
00176        *   scalefactor   : Scale factor                                  (input)
00177        *
00178        */
00179 
00180       void defineDatum( const int datumType, const char *datumCode, const char *datumName, const char *ellipsoidCode,
00181                          double deltaX, double deltaY, double deltaZ,
00182                          double sigmaX, double sigmaY,  double sigmaZ,
00183                          double westLongitude, double eastLongitude, double southLatitude, double northLatitude,
00184                          double rotationX, double rotationY,  double rotationZ, double scaleFactor);
00185 
00186 
00187       /*
00188        * The function removeDatum deletes a local (3-parameter) datum with the
00189        * specified code.  If the datum table has not been initialized or a new
00190        * version of the 3-param.dat file cannot be created, an exception is thrown.
00191        * Note that the indexes of all datums
00192        * in the datum table may be changed by this function.
00193        *
00194        *   code           : 5-letter datum code.                      (input)
00195        *
00196        */
00197 
00198       void removeDatum( const char* code );
00199 
00200 
00201       /*
00202        *  The function datumCode returns the 5-letter code of the datum
00203        *  referenced by index.
00204        *
00205        *  index   : The index of a given datum in the datum table.        (input)
00206        *  code    : The datum Code of the datum referenced by Index.      (output)
00207        */
00208 
00209       void datumCode( const long index, char *code );
00210 
00211 
00212       /*
00213        *  The function getDatumCount returns the number of Datums in the table
00214        *  if the table was initialized without error.
00215        *
00216        *  count        : number of datums in the datum table     (output)
00217        */
00218 
00219       void getDatumCount( long *count );
00220 
00221 
00222       /*
00223        *  The function getDatumIndex returns the index of the datum with the
00224        *  specified code.
00225        *
00226        *  code    : The datum code being searched for.                    (input)
00227        *  index   : The index of the datum in the table with the          (output)
00228        *              specified code.
00229        */
00230 
00231       void getDatumIndex( const char *code, long *index );
00232 
00233 
00234       /*
00235        *  The function getDatumInfo returns the 5-letter code, name and
00236        *  2-letter ellipsoid code of the datum referenced by index.
00237        *
00238        *  index            : The index of a given datum in the datum table.        (input)
00239        *  code             : The datum Code of the datum referenced by Index.      (output)
00240        *  name             : The datum Name of the datum referenced by Index.      (output)
00241        *  ellipsoidCode    : The ellipsoid code for the ellipsoid associated with  (output)
00242        *                     the datum referenced by index.
00243        */
00244 
00245       void getDatumInfo( const long index, char *code, char *name, char *ellipsoidCode );
00246 
00247 
00248       /*
00249        *   The function datumErrors returns the standard errors in X,Y, & Z
00250        *   for the datum referenced by index.
00251        *
00252        *    index      : The index of a given datum in the datum table   (input)
00253        *    sigma_X    : Standard error in X in meters                   (output)
00254        *    sigma_Y    : Standard error in Y in meters                   (output)
00255        *    sigma_Z    : Standard error in Z in meters                   (output)
00256        */
00257 
00258       void getDatumParameters( const long index, DatumType::Enum *datumType, double *deltaX, double *deltaY, double *deltaZ,
00259                                double *sigmaX, double *sigmaY, double *sigmaZ,
00260                                double *westLongitude, double *eastLongitude, double *southLatitude, double *northLatitude,
00261                                double *rotationX, double *rotationY, double *rotationZ, double *scaleFactor );
00262 
00263 
00264       /*
00265        *   The function datumValidRectangle returns the edges of the validity
00266        *   rectangle for the datum referenced by index.
00267        *
00268        *   index          : The index of a given datum in the datum table   (input)
00269        *   westLongitude : Western edge of validity rectangle in radians   (output)
00270        *   eastLongitude : Eastern edge of validity rectangle in radians   (output)
00271        *   southLatitude : Southern edge of validity rectangle in radians  (output)
00272        *   northLatitude : Northern edge of validity rectangle in radians  (output)
00273        *
00274        */
00275 
00276       void getDatumValidRectangle( const long index, double *westLongitude, double *eastLongitude, double *southLatitude, double *northLatitude );
00277 
00278 
00279     private:
00280 
00281       DatumLibraryImplementation* _datumLibraryImplementation;
00282 
00283     };
00284   }
